issue.title: Enhancement Request- Gridding / Alignment of Chart Areas
issue.body:
Grafana: 5.0.3
Grafana host: Windows 7 Pro, 64 bit
MySQL server: Maria DB 10.2, Debian Jessie 64 bit

**Enhancement Request**

The Grafana dashboard drawing tools work by aligning the bounding box / outer edge of each panel (at least in the horizontal direction) to a layout grid. This makes it easy to get a tidy-looking dashboard layout set up quickly.

However, the internal layout of panels is largely automatic, based on the contents. There is the ability to set a minimum width on the Legend (if it exists), but other than that it's a "black box" process. This means that when multiple charts are stacked, the actual chart areas (e.g. where the time series are drawn) may not align, if (for example) the space taken up by the axis labels differs between the charts.

See below for an example. I've deliberately made this extreme by removing the legend from one chart, but in practice differences in charts like, say, having a difference in the number format on axis labels will lead to minor misalignment, which is in some ways more disconcerting.

This is especially true when using the "Shared crosshair" or "Shared tooltip" option, which sees the crosshair "bending" as it is moved across the charts

![grafana chart alignment](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28898330/38149244-c3056aee-3451-11e8-9a8f-632bd99c5709.png)

I realise this could be a challenging problem to solve. Some initial thoughts on how this could be handled are-

1. Have an alternative layout mode that works "chart area out" rather than "panel area in". In this mode the user would drag the corners of the chart area to align with the grid, and the layout logic would then "shrink wrap" the axis labels, legend, title etc. around the chart body. Note this could lead to inconsistent panel sizes misaligned to the grid unless the panel widths were "rounded up" to the next available gridding point (i.e. adding empty padding space within the panel to make it fit the grid).

2. Keep the panel layout UI the same as today, but allow the chart area to be dragged (reduced in size only), maybe against a finer "sub grid" than the panels themselves, to allow multiple charts to be properly aligned.

issue.title: Fix #10555 #6888 Backslash in Prometheus variables
issue.body:
Prior this commit, `C:\bar` was escaped `C:\\\bar`. Should be `C:\\\\bar`.

Signed-off-by: Julien Pivotto <roidelapluie@inuits.eu>

issue.title: Caching issues after upgrading a plugin
issue.body:
In a recent release of a plugin, i changed the path to an html file and a couple people are seeing 404s.  After investigating, it looks like caching issues in production mode.

https://github.com/NatelEnergy/grafana-discrete-panel/issues/46

I don't know if there is a good solution.  It looks like the some files get a version appended to the end to bust the cache, but the javascript files do not.

issue.title: [Graph Feature] Allow X-value to be a non-time metric
issue.body:
Graph panel should support non time x-axis
- [x] Time series name on x-axis and last/total/max/etc as y
- [x] Table data format queries (ex from InfluxDB)
- [x] Json data query from ES

comment.body: @torkelo You said that graphs can be set to display each time series as an x-axis tick.  How do you set that option?

repo.name: grafana

issue.title: snapshot of dashboard containing graphs gives "unauthorized" error
issue.body:
- What Grafana version are you using?
4.6.3
- What datasource are you using?
influxdb and zabbix. The problem is present with both
- What OS are you running grafana on?
Debian Stretch (9.3)
- What did you do?
Created a dashboard with several panels: graphs, single values, tables. Generated a snapshot for that dashboard. 
- What was the expected result?
The snapshot should load with all data visible and no error
- What happened instead?
The dashboard loads properly but gives a popup "Unauthorized" and all the graphs are empty. Single value panels and tables are properly working. Tested with only one graph and the problems shows up not matter the datasource I used: zabbix or influxdb.
 
Chrome's dev tools show the error could be related to annotations, could be related to #7659 ?
![snapshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138363/34764686-8a191d02-f5ef-11e7-8a58-ca225e5f87ab.png)

comment.body: @beerygaz I have the same issue have you snapshot loads fast, only graphs loads in seconds. Timeout it longer, have you figured out what to do about this?

issue.title: Provide way of uninstalling a plugin (or don't suggest upgrading it)
issue.body:
- **I'm submitting a ...**
- [ ] Bug report
- [X] Feature request
- [ ] Question / Support request: **Please do not** open a github issue. [Support Options](http://grafana.org/support/)

Please include this information:
- What Grafana version are you using?

ii  grafana                           3.1.1-1470047149      amd64                 Grafana
- What datasource are you using?
- What OS are you running grafana on?

debian
- What did you do?

installed worldping, deactivated it
- What was the expected result?

have the possibility of uninstalling it. 
- What happened instead?

the plugin is still there and I get notifications to upgrade it 

![screenshot from 2016-08-02 14-45-20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/445200/17330173/15d00eaa-58c6-11e6-97eb-45788fcc74bc.png)

comment.body: Same issue in 2018. I can't remove apps from hosted instances. I have to create a new account each time I want to remove an app.

issue.title: Unable to add graphite functions in the latest build
issue.body:
Hi there. I faced quite weird issue while was trying to upgrade grafana. It's not possible to add functions to the query (there is no button for it). Chrome console contains the following error message:
```
Error: [$injector:unpr] Unknown provider: tProvider <- t <- graphiteAddFuncDirective
```
It's still possible to add function manually in edit mode so the issue is not very critical for me. The strangest thing in this situation is that I can't reproduce the issue in development mode. I can reproduce it only with grafana-server launched.
My current branch is at b41370ca498816f444363ed7511dced638dc54f6

comment.body:
Yea I haven't noticed. It's also missing on `graphiteFuncEditor`. 
I can make a pull request with these 2 but there is still a chance that some other parts of system are not annotated. So maybe it makes sense to test the system in production mode somehow and fix all issues at once.

issue.title: Total the current value
issue.body:
Hello I have installed Telegraf, InfluxDB and Grafana to Monitor Network Statistics. 

And I have added my 5 switch with custom OID value and its giving the exact value

Now I want to calculate the total value of **current value**

I tried to do that but it showing overall total value for every switch instead of that I need to calculate the current value of all 5 switch. 

Previously I have used cacti to get the total count. Now I want to use grafana
![total](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37932454/38138705-c97c68f4-341b-11e8-873d-1c505a58dfec.png)

issue.title: Values from Prometheus fluctuate from real value to zero with each refresh
issue.body:
Read before posting: 

- Questions should be posted to https://community.grafana.com. Please search there and here on GitHub for similar issues before creating a new issue. 
- Checkout FAQ: https://community.grafana.com/c/howto/faq
- Checkout How to troubleshoot metric query issues: https://community.grafana.com/t/how-to-troubleshoot-metric-query-issues/50

Please include this information:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3 and 5.0.4
### What datasource are you using?
Prometheus 2.2.1
### What OS are you running grafana on?
Grafana's Official Docker 
### What did you do?
Configured Prometheus as a data source. On refresh the values on all graphs fluctuate from real value to zero with each refresh.
### What was the expected result?
Real values should be displayed.
### What happened instead?
### If related to metric query / data viz:
### Include raw network request & response: get by opening Chrome Dev Tools (F12, Ctrl+Shift+I on windows, Cmd+Opt+I on Mac), go the network tab.
 
True Values:

![selection_010](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6275314/38138076-5ee6ee54-3431-11e8-8fe5-73a56fbc2939.png)

After auto refresh: 

![selection_011](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6275314/38138099-8fc12e36-3431-11e8-8221-22011ab6f236.png)

issue.title: Graph disappears when switching tabs on chrome
issue.body:
- What Grafana version are you using? 4.6.3 (commit: 7a06a47)
- What datasource are you using? OpenTSDB
- What OS are you running grafana on? CentOS
- What did you do? Load dashboard; switch tabs; go back to grafana tab
- What was the expected result? graph should stay visible
- What happened instead? graph disappears

The graph only reappears after refreshing or resizing the window. After some troubleshooting, I disabled "accelerated 2D canvas" in chrome://flags, which fixed the issue but made the interaction really slow. This issue can be seen on Chrome running on Ubuntu 14.04 with Nvidia GPU:

Relevant client information:
Chrome/64.0.3282.167
Linux 4.4.0-116-generic
GL_VENDOR | NVIDIA Corporation
GL_RENDERER | GeForce GTX 1060 6GB/PCIe/SSE2
GL_VERSION | 4.6.0 NVIDIA 390.25

Works fine on Firefox on the same machine.

issue.title: why   $tag_<tag_key>  not working in 5.0.3 ?
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?

5.0.3

### What datasource are you using?
influxdb

### What OS are you running grafana on?
ubuntu16.04

### What did you do?

$tag_host working in my grafana-4.6, but not working in 5.0

comment.body: For ```$tag_<tag_key>``` to work you need to group by ```<tag_key>```
